V.ii.3.D.1.a
.
Choosing From Multiple Possible DCs
Diagnostic Codes (DCs) must be carefully selected and reasons for selection given if two or more are applicable.  When multiple DCs apply to a given disability, consider
whether separate evaluations are warranted, and/or
which DC will result in the most advantageous outcome for the claimant.
References
:  For more information on
determining whether separate evaluations are warranted, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 3.D.2.b
, and
38 CFR 4.14
providing the reason for selection of a DC in the rating decision, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.A.6.B
, and
Suttman v. Brown
, 5 Vet.App. 127 (1993), and
procedures for entering DCs in the Veterans Benefits Management System-Rating (VBMS-R), see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.C.2
.
